info.description: A cloud native access control server providing best-practice patterns (RBAC, ABAC, ACL, AWS IAM Policies, Kubernetes Roles, ...) via REST APIs.
info.title: ORY Keto

post.description:
Use this endpoint to check if a request is allowed or not. If the request is allowed, a 200 response with
`{"allowed":"true"}` will be sent. If the request is denied, a 403 response with `{"allowed":"false"}` will
be sent instead.
post.summary: Check if a request is allowed

get.description:
Roles group several subjects into one. Rules can be assigned to ORY Access Control Policy (OACP) by using the Role ID
as subject in the OACP.

parameters.description: The member for which the roles are to be listed.

get.description:
This endpoint returns a 200 status code when the HTTP server is up running.
This status does currently not include checks whether the database connection is working.

If the service supports TLS Edge Termination, this endpoint does not require the
`X-Forwarded-Proto` header to be set.

Be aware that if you are running multiple nodes of this service, the health status will never
refer to the cluster state, only to a single instance.

This endpoint returns a 200 status code when the HTTP server is up running and the environment dependencies (e.g.
the database) are responsive as well.

If the service supports TLS Edge Termination, this endpoint does not require the
`X-Forwarded-Proto` header to be set.

Be aware that if you are running multiple nodes of this service, the health status will never
refer to the cluster state, only to a single instance.

This endpoint returns the service version typically notated using semantic versioning.

If the service supports TLS Edge Termination, this endpoint does not require the
`X-Forwarded-Proto` header to be set.

Be aware that if you are running multiple nodes of this service, the health status will never
refer to the cluster state, only to a single instance.

OryAccessControlPolicies.title: OryAccessControlPolicies OryAccessControlPolicies OryAccessControlPolicies Policies is an array of policies.

Body.description:
The request body.

in: body
type: array

OryAccessControlPolicy.title: OryAccessControlPolicy OryAccessControlPolicy oryAccessControlPolicy specifies an ORY Access Policy document.

actions.description: Actions is an array representing all the actions this ORY Access Policy applies to.

conditions.description: Conditions represents a keyed object of conditions under which this ORY Access Policy is active.

description.description: Description is an optional, human-readable description.

effect.description: Effect is the effect of this ORY Access Policy. It can be "allow" or "deny".

id.description: ID is the unique identifier of the ORY Access Policy. It is used to query, update, and remove the ORY Access Policy.

resources.description: Resources is an array representing all the resources this ORY Access Policy applies to.

subjects.description: Subjects is an array representing all the subjects this ORY Access Policy applies to.

OryAccessControlPolicyAllowedInput.title: OryAccessControlPolicyAllowedInput OryAccessControlPolicyAllowedInput OryAccessControlPolicyAllowedInput Input for checking if a request is allowed or not.

action.description: Action is the action that is requested on the resource.

context.description: Context is the request's environmental context.

resource.description: Resource is the resource that access is requested to.

subject.description: Subject is the subject that is requesting access.

OryAccessControlPolicyRole.description:
OryAccessControlPolicyRole OryAccessControlPolicyRole OryAccessControlPolicyRole oryAccessControlPolicyRole represents a group of users that share the same role. A role could be an administrator, a moderator, a regular
user or some other sort of role.

id.description: ID is the role's unique id.

members.description: Members is who belongs to the role.

OryAccessControlPolicyRoles.title: OryAccessControlPolicyRoles OryAccessControlPolicyRoles Roles is an array of roles.

Body.description:
The request body.

in: body
